@@ -0,0 +1,133 @@

+
+#include "lmdb.h"
+#include "tensorflow/core/framework/reader_op_kernel.h"
+#include "tensorflow/core/framework/reader_base.h"
+#include "tensorflow/core/lib/core/errors.h"
+
+#include <sys/stat.h>
+
+namespace tensorflow {
+
+inline void MDB_CHECK(int mdb_status) {
+  CHECK_EQ(mdb_status, MDB_SUCCESS) << mdb_strerror(mdb_status);
+}
+
+class LMDBReader : public ReaderBase {
+ public:
+  LMDBReader(const string& node_name, Env* env)
+      : ReaderBase(strings::StrCat("LMDBReader '", node_name, "'")),
+        env_(env),
+        mdb_env_(nullptr),
+        mdb_dbi_(0),
+        mdb_txn_(nullptr),
+        mdb_cursor_(nullptr) {}
+
+  Status OnWorkStartedLocked() override {
+    MDB_CHECK(mdb_env_create(&mdb_env_));
+    int flags = MDB_RDONLY | MDB_NOTLS;
+
+    // Check if the LMDB filename is actually a file instead of a directory.
+    // If so, set appropriate flags so we can open it.
+    struct stat source_stat;
+    if (stat(current_work().c_str(), &source_stat) == 0 &&
+        (source_stat.st_mode & S_IFREG)) {
+      flags |= MDB_NOSUBDIR;
body: There should be unit tests for both variants here, i.e. specifying a file versus specifying a directory. What happens if you specify a directory? Is there a default database file name that lmdb tries to read from?
body_html: There should be unit tests for both variants here, i.e. specifying a file versus specifying a directory. What happens if you specify a directory? Is there a default database file name that lmdb tries to read from?
